greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Lexicographically earliest sequence such that a(i) = a(j) => f(i) = f(j) for all i, j >= 1, where f(n) = -1 if n is an odd prime, f(n) = -2 if n = 2^k, with k > 1, and f(n) = n for all other numbers.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..65537
formula: If n <= 2, a(n) = n, for n > 2, if n is an odd prime, a(n) = 3, if n = 2^k, with k >= 2, a(n) = 4, otherwise a(n) = 4 + n - A000523(n) - A000720(n).
program: rgs_transform(invec) = { my(om = Map(), outvec = vector(length(invec)), u=1); for(i=1, length(invec), if(mapisdefined(om,invec[i]), my(pp = mapget(om, invec[i])); outvec[i] = outvec[pp] , mapput(om,invec[i],i); outvec[i] = u; u++ )); outvec; };
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Mar 01 2019
